text.name: sys_description
text.text: The TIC-80 is a virtual computer, which has never physically existed, designed to easily design, play and share mini-games. To respect a retro style, the technical limitations of the machine are a display of 16 colors in 240x136 pixels, 256 color sprites in 8x8 and safe 4-channel sound. The integrated development tool is in command line and an interface facilitates the creation of sprites and music. It allows you to get the virtual cartridge file to share. The demake of the fantastic "Super Meat Boy", was among many others, made on this machine.
